intro: Centaurium pulchellum f. albiflorum, commonly known as the white-flowered lesser centaury, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Gentianaceae. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The inflorescence consists of numerous tiny, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. The leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often covered with fine hairs. This plant thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges, and is often found in temperate regions of Europe.
